# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/scope.py
@source-hash: 4cc514f2aa35eed8
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:48Z

## Purpose
Rich console library module for rendering Python variable scopes as formatted console output. Provides functionality to display local/global variables with syntax highlighting and structured formatting.

## Key Components

### render_scope() Function (L14-67)
Primary function that converts a mapping of variable names/values into a Rich ConsoleRenderable.

**Parameters:**
- `scope`: Mapping[str, Any] - Variable name-to-value mapping (typically from locals()/globals())
- `title`: Optional title text for the rendered panel
- `sort_keys`: bool - Whether to sort variables alphabetically (default True)  
- `indent_guides`: bool - Enable Pretty printing indentation guides
- `max_length`/`max_string`: Optional limits for container/string truncation

**Implementation:**
- Uses ReprHighlighter for syntax coloring (L37)
- Creates grid-based Table layout with right-justified keys (L38-39)
- Special handling for dunder variables (__name__, etc.) via sort_items() helper (L41-44)
- Applies semantic styling: "scope.key.special" for dunder vars, "scope.key" for normal vars (L48-49)
- Wraps Pretty objects with highlighting and formatting options (L54-60)
- Returns Panel.fit() with "scope.border" styling (L62-67)

### sort_items() Helper (L41-44)
Nested function providing custom sorting logic - prioritizes dunder variables first, then alphabetical by lowercase key.

## Dependencies
- Rich components: ReprHighlighter, Panel, Pretty, Table, Text
- Standard library: collections.abc.Mapping, typing utilities

## Architecture Patterns
- Uses Rich's component composition pattern (Table + Panel + Pretty)
- Semantic CSS-like styling with theme keys ("scope.key", "scope.border", etc.)
- Follows Rich's ConsoleRenderable protocol for render pipeline integration

## Demo Code (L70-85)
Test function demonstrating usage with locals() scope, showing mixed data types in formatted output.
